Back to Franz Liszt

Franz Liszt

O sacrum convivium, S. 674a

c. 1880–1885 · LW E36 · R. –

Liszt originally wrote O sacrum convivium for women’s voices and organ or harmonium (S. 58; LW J40; R. 515). He later made an arrangement for solo organ or harmonium (S. 674a; LW E36); this can also be played effectively on the piano. The arrangement includes two short ossia passages of thirteen bars in total (S. 674a bis).

Recommended editions

  • Universal Edition · UE 17888 · Sämtliche Orgelwerke / Band 6 · ed. Martin Haselböck [including ossia passages]

Duration: 6' 30"

Difficulty: 1.5
